page.title: 02Farming
page.content:
Most of the farming land belongs to the Duchy of Cornwall. The farmers say that the rents are high and they have to use very efficient methods in order to survive. There are some areas of land which are privately owned.
Mixed farming methods are used and a variety of animals are kept and a mixture of crops grown, thus retaining the appearance of traditional English farming methods. Recently, the use of rape as a crop has introduced a vivid yellow into the spring landscape, and Dutch elm disease has deprived us of many beautiful old trees.
The introduction of mechanisation means that less workers are employed, and many of the old tied cottages have been converted into expensive houses.
